lead_paragraph: Lawmakers passed, and Gov. Jerry Brown promised to sign, bills requiring the state to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to 40 percent below 1990 levels.

byline.contributor: Jennifer Medina reported from Los Angeles, and Matt Richtel from San Francisco.
byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA and MATT RICHTEL

headline.print_headline: Carbon Goal in California Is ‘Milestone’ on Climate
headline.main: California’s Emissions Goal Is a ‘Milestone’ on Climate Efforts

snippet: Lawmakers passed, and Gov. Jerry Brown promised to sign, bills requiring the state to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to 40 percent below 1990 levels....
abstract: California Legislature passes law extending state's landmark climate change legislation to 2030 and requiring state to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to 40 percent below 1990 levels; moves solidify state's status as leader in effort to reduce emissions, but experts warn they still fall short of measures needed to stave off worst effects of global warming.
